name: shake
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move backwards and forwards or up and down in quick, short movements, or to make something or someone do this

example.eg: A young boy climbed into the apple tree and shook the branches so that the fruit fell down.
example.egtrans: 一个男孩爬上苹果树，用力摇着枝条好让苹果掉下来。

example.eg: Babies like toys that make a noise when they're shaken.
example.egtrans: 婴儿喜欢摇晃时能发出声响的玩具。

example.eg: The explosion shook buildings for miles around.
example.egtrans: 爆炸让好几英里以内的房屋都受到震动。

example.eg: People in southern California were shaken awake by an earthquake.
example.egtrans: 加利福尼亚南部的人们被地震震醒了。

example.eg: She shook her hair loose from its ribbon.
example.egtrans: 她抖了抖头发，把丝带抖掉。

example.eg: Anna shook some powdered chocolate over her coffee.
example.egtrans: 安娜往咖啡里撒了一些巧克力粉。

example.eg: Every time one of these big trucks goes by, all the houses shake.
example.egtrans: 每当这样的一辆大卡车经过时，所有的房屋都会颤动。

example.eg: The child's body was shaking with sobs.
example.egtrans: 这个孩子哭得身子一颤一颤的。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you are shaking, your body makes quick short movements, or you feel as if it is doing so, because you are frightened or nervous.

example.eg: She was shaking as she opened the letter.
example.egtrans: 她颤抖着拆开了信。

example.eg: I was shaking in my shoes/boots (= very nervous) about having to tell Dad what I'd done.
example.egtrans: 想到不得不告诉爸爸我的所作所为时，我害怕得直发抖。

example.eg: I was shaking like a leaf (= very nervous) before the test.
example.egtrans: 我考试前特别紧张。

trans_examp.trans_en: If your voice shakes, it makes you sound nervous or frightened.

example.eg: Her voice shook as she talked about the person who attacked her.
example.egtrans: 她谈起攻击她的人时声音直打颤。

phrase.phrase_title: shake sb's hand/shake sb by the hand

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hold someone's hand and move it up and down, especially when you meet them for the first time or when you make an agreement with them
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指初次见面或达成协议时）握（某人的）手

example.eg: "Pleased to meet you," he said, shaking my hand.
example.egtrans: “很高兴见到你，”他边说边与我握手。

example.eg: "Congratulations," she said, shaking the winner by the hand.
example.egtrans: “祝贺你，”她说着握了握获胜者的手。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If two people shake hands, they greet each other or say goodbye by briefly joining hands and moving them slightly up and down.

example.eg: The Princess was photographed shaking hands with AIDS victims.
example.egtrans: 王妃与艾滋病患者握手的场面被拍了下来。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If two people shake (hands) on something, they make an agreement by briefly joining hands and moving them slightly up and down.

example.eg: It seems that we have a deal, so let's shake (hands) on it.
example.egtrans: 看来我们成交了，来握个手吧。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to move your head from side to side, in order to express disagreement, sadness, or that you do not want or believe something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 摇头（表示不同意、悲伤、不想要或不信）

example.eg: I asked Tim if he'd seen Jackie lately but he shook his head.
example.egtrans: 我问蒂姆近来是否见过杰基，他摇了摇头。

example.eg: "That's incredible!" he said, shaking his head in disbelief.
example.egtrans: “简直难以置信！”他一边说，一边不相信地摇着头。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hold your hand up in the air with your fingers and thumb bent, and move it forcefully backwards and forwards, to show that you are angry

example.eg: He shook his fist at the driver who pulled out in front of him.
example.egtrans: 他向那个突然由路边冲到他前面行驶的司机挥了挥拳头。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause to feel upset and worried
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使烦恼；使心绪不定；使震惊

example.eg: The child seemed nervous and visibly shaken.
example.egtrans: 这孩子看上去很紧张，明显是吓着了。

example.eg: The news has shaken the whole country.
example.egtrans: 消息震惊了全国。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something less certain, firm, or strong

example.eg: What has happened has shaken the foundations of her belief.
example.egtrans: 发生的事情动摇了她信仰的根基。

example.eg: After six defeats in a row, the team's confidence has been badly shaken.
example.egtrans: 在六连败后，球队的信心大挫。

example.eg: This discovery may shake (up) traditional theories on how mountains are formed.
example.egtrans: 这个发现可能会动摇关于山脉形成的传统理论。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get rid of or escape from something

example.eg: It's very difficult to shake the habit of a lifetime.
example.egtrans: 终身养成的习惯是很难改掉的。

example.eg: The company has so far been unable to shake (off) its reputation for being old-fashioned.
example.egtrans: 该公司到现在为止还未能摆脱其因循守旧的名声。

name: shake
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: She gave the box a shake to see if there was anything inside it.
example.egtrans: 她摇了摇盒子，看里面有没有东西。

example.eg: "No, no, no," he said with a shake of his head.
example.egtrans: “不，不，不，”他摇着头说。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: short, quick movements from side to side that your body makes because you are ill, are frightened, or have drunk too much alcohol

example.eg: I watched her hands as she prepared coffee and she definitely had the shakes.
example.egtrans: 她准备咖啡的时候，我看着她的手，她绝对在发抖。
